articles.author: Lim Hui Jie
articles.title: Asia markets slip as BOJ holds rates; China factory activity expands for first time since April - CNBC
articles.description: The Bank of Japan is expected to hold rates at 0.25%, according to a Reuters poll of economists.
articles.content:
Kazuo Ueda, governor of the Bank of Japan (BOJ), speaks during a news conference at the central bank's headquarters in Tokyo, Japan
